name: Crystalwort
description: Riccia fluitans, commonly known as Crystalwort, Floating Crystalwort, or Floating Liverwort, is a free-floating aquatic liverwort (bryophyte) native to slow-moving or still water bodies worldwide, including Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas. It belongs to the Ricciaceae family and features branching, ribbon-like thalli (plant body) that form dense, bright green mats. The thalli are flat, forked, and grow in a Y-shaped branching pattern, creating a moss-like appearance. Unlike true mosses, this is a liverwort - a primitive non-vascular plant. The plant displays a mat-forming, creeping growth habit and can form dense carpets when attached to surfaces or float freely. It has no true roots, stems, or leaves - the entire plant body is a thallus. In its native habitat, it grows floating on the surface of still or slow-moving water or attached to submerged surfaces. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty, excellent water filtration, and provides hiding places for small aquatic life. It's extremely popular in aquascaping for creating moss carpets.
careTips: Can float freely or be attached to hardscape (rocks, driftwood) or mesh for carpet effect
Attach to mesh or plastic grids for carpet - use thread, fishing line, or mesh to secure
Benefits from CO2 injection (20-30 ppm) for faster, denser growth
Provides excellent hiding places for shrimp, fry, and small fish
Native to worldwide distribution - prefers moderate temperatures (15-28Â°C)
Moderate to high light recommended (2-3 watts per gallon) for best growth
Prefers pH 6.0-7.5 and soft to moderately hard water (2-12 dGH)
Benefits from regular fertilization - absorbs nutrients directly through thalli
Non-toxic and safe for all aquarium inhabitants
Can be used in aquariums, paludariums, and ripariums
Propagates via fragmentation - simply break off pieces and they will grow
If thalli turn brown, increase light or add CO2
Requires some water movement to prevent debris accumulation
